title: Giants turn tables on Eagles with complete home victory
content: The Giants started fast, fell behind, then dominated the second half to take down their hated division rivals.

title: Sister Jean, beloved Loyola-Chicago chaplain, dies
content: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, the longtime chaplain of the Loyola-Chicago men's basketball team, died Thursday at the age of 106. "[She] was an invaluable source of wisdom and grace for generations of students, faculty, and staff," the school said.

title: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
content: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.

title: Dart, Giants hope win over Eagles shifts narrative
content: Jaxson Dart led the Giants to a convincing 34-17 win over the Eagles on Thursday night, a victory that they hope begins to change the perception of the team, which went 3-14 last season.

title: Boyd, Happ atone for struggles as Cubs force G5
content: The Cubs got a lift from two struggling players Thursday night, as starter Matthew Boyd and left fielder Ian Happ helped set the tone in a 6-0 Game 4 victory over the Brewers.

title: LeBron out 3-4 weeks, set to miss Lakers opener
content: Lakers star LeBron James will be sidelined an additional three to four weeks because of sciatica on his right side, the team announced Thursday.

title: Eagles RT Johnson calls for 'less predictable' attack
content: Eagles right tackle Lane Johnson said the offense needs to work hard to "keep defenses guessing" after Thursday night's 34-17 loss to the Giants.

title: Ex-Fins safety Jones awarded $9.5M in fraud suit
content: Former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones has settled a lawsuit against Merrill Lynch for $9.5 million after a former financial adviser allegedly stole $2.59 million from the two-time Pro Bowler.

title: 📸 Reese to walk Victoria's Secret show runway
content: The Chicago Sky star will make history as the first professional athlete to walk in the fashion show.

title: Week 7 preview: Key conference matchups, Oklahoma's 'Dog Pound' defense and more
content: Our college football experts give us insight on key Big Ten and SEC matchups, plus Oklahoma's defense.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do in each league﻿
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Ranking the NFL's eight divisions from first to worst -- including one that could have four playoff teams
content: Can any division match the NFC North? How do QB injuries impact the AFC North's standing? And which division lands at the bottom of our list?

title: Has the rookie RB class lived up to its predraft hype? Barnwell breaks down five standouts
content: The rookie RB class could end up being elite. Let's look closer at Jacory Croskey-Merritt and others.

title: The NBA's next Chosen One will be ... tough to predict: Five paths the face of the league could follow
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram explores the players who could follow in Steph Curry's and LeBron James' footsteps.

title: Kung Fu, meditation and a 'Dream Shake': Inside Victor Wembanyama's return
content: A "traumatic experience" with deep vein thrombosis prompted a summer of exploration for the Spurs star.

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Phillies after NLDS defeat
content: Here's how the winter looks in Philly -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: WWE Crown Jewel preview: Rollins-Rhodes, Cena tour stop, more
content: As WWE Crown Jewel heads to Perth, Western Australia, we break down the biggest storylines, including John Cena's retirement tour.

title: Inside WNBA players' rocky relationship with commissioner Cathy Engelbert
content: Napheesa Collier's scathing criticism was only the most recent example of players' eroding trust in the WNBA commissioner.

title: WNBA Finals Game 3 guide: How the Aces beat the Mercury
content: Everything that happened in Game 3, including A'ja Wilson's historic night and Satou Sabally's injury.

title: No gap year here: How the Celtics and Pacers approach a season without their leaders
content: Despite injuries to Tyrese Haliburton and Jayson Tatum, the Pacers and Celtics are still approaching the 2025-26 season as win now.

title: Wyshynski predicts every NHL team's finish in 2025-26
content: As the season begins, we reveal which teams will make the Stanley Cup Final, the playoffs and the draft lottery.

title: How the Ducks are building a new Western power
content: After patiently developing a collection of impressive young talent, the ingredients are now there to contend.

title: 75 stadiums, 45 states, one vision: Why the Savannah Bananas' next step is their biggest yet
content: The Savannah Bananas prepare for a new era of bodacious baseball. Check out what "Banana Ball" is doing next.

title: The race to be No. 9: Which strikers will the USMNT take to the World Cup?
content: The USMNT's history of productive strikers is limited, but ahead of the World Cup, several are in the form of their lives. So who will make the team?

title: The best teams in Europe right now: Bayern, Kane setting the tone
content: Bayern Munich's start to the season has been astonishingly good, but where does the rest of Europe fall in Bill Connelly's rankings?

title: Rogers enters No. 10 debate for England, but who will Tuchel end up trusting?
content: Taking advantage of some absences, has Morgan Rogers done enough to ensure a permanent starting role?

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Should you move on from Jameson Williams, A.J. Brown or other disappointing picks?
content: Matt Bowen discusses eight players who have fallen short of expectations early on, and how to value them.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Brazilian Charles Oliveira stay unbeaten in his home country?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the UFC Fight Night Rio main event, and Ian Parker gives value picks for the card.

title: How six fighters could test Terence Crawford's boxing skills
content: After a dominating win over Canelo Alvarez, forget about a rematch. Here are six fights for Terence Crawford to enhance his legacy.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Tristan Wirfs witnessed Baker Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seattle Seahawks fan last Sunday.

title: Early 2026 boys' recruiting class rankings: The surprise SEC team on top
content: With only one top-10 player committed, some surprising programs have emerged with the strongest classes so far.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to return for Juve's Yildiz
content: Chelsea are lining up another approach for Juventus' Kenan Yildiz. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: College football best bets for Week 7: Why an 0-5 team should be on your bet slip
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 7 of the college football season, including what makes UMass-Kent State a solid game to bet.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: Predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea on cough syrup deaths
content: The petitioner said ‘precious time’ was passing without any substantial steps taken in the investigation by the States

title: Kerala Tourism marks John Lennon’s 85th birthday with ‘Imagine’-inspired post celebrating peace
content: A picture featuring five women artistes clad in the traditional attire of three religious art forms and crossing a road with the tagline ‘Imagine/ all the people/ livin’ life in peace’ reminds netizens of John Lennon’s message about peace

title: Villupuram MP urges Union Finance Minister to continue GST concession on car purchases for persons with disabilities
content: In a letter to Nirmala Sitharaman, the MP said persons with disabilities were earlier provided 10% GST concession on the purchase of cars, paying only 18% GST, instead of the standard rate. However, following the recent revision in GST slabs, all small cars are now uniformly taxed at 18%

title: Bengal Job scam allegations: ED conducts search operations at six locations in Kolkata
content: The ED raids include Minister Sujit Bose’s residence-cum-office in Salt Lake, and the houses of former officials of the Dum Dum Municipality

title: U.S. Ambassador to India Sergio Gor in Delhi to hold bilateral discussions
content: Sergio Gor and U.S. Deputy Secretary for Management and Resources Michael J. Rigas are meeting their counterparts to discuss bilateral issues

title: Zubeen Garg's personal security officers arrested in singer's death case
content: Nandeswar Bora and Paresh Baishya, deputed by the government as part of Garg's security detail, were suspended by the Assam Police on Tuesday (October 7) after multiple rounds of questioning

title: India notifies first emission intensity targets for carbon-intensive sectors
content: According to the notification, each facility must reduce the amount of greenhouse gases emitted per unit of output compared to a 2023-24 baseline.

title: Trump has claimed that he stopped Operation Sindoor using trade 50 times now: Congress
content: He did not, of course, forget to speak to the man who had unleashed the genocide on Gaza - the Israeli PM Benjamin  Netanyahu - also during this time, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Kerala MLA U. Prathibha’s remark on inviting ‘scantily clad’ stars for inaugurations sparks row
content: Speaking at an event, Kayamkulam MLA said ‘when an actor comes without wearing proper clothes, people flock to that programme in large numbers. We should tell them to stop that’

title: Poll code violation case against Pappu Yadav for distributing money among flood victims in Vaishali
content: The case was registered against Mr. Yadav, the Independent MP from Purnea, at the Sahdei police station on Thursday (October 9, 2025) night on the basis of a complaint filed by the district administration

title: AI-powered alerts systems saved over five lakh lives during 2024 Kerala floods, said MoS Communications
content: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) uses the Cell Broadcast System (CBS) to send emergency alerts during disasters like floods, cyclones, or earthquakes.

title: Police told to take strict action against lawbreakers: Ajit Pawar on row over gangster Ghaywal
content: I have given clear instructions to the Pune Police Commissioner to take the strongest action against those who try to violate the rules and take the law into their own hands, says Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar

title: Conrad Sangma's NPP played role in destroying Manipur's stability, alleges Congress
content: Since 2017, the BJP and its ally NPP have played a major role in destroying the stability and spirit of the State — truly, BJP and NPP are two faces of the same coin, says Manipur Congress president Keisham Meghachandra

title: Karur stampede hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to hear TVK’s plea challenging High Court order to set up SIT
content: TVK has urged that a ‘pre-planned conspiracy by certain miscreants to create trouble at the site of the rally cannot be ruled out.’

title: Fight to protect Chelam Hill gets stronger in northern Andhra Pradesh
content: APGENCO’s proposed 3,200 MW supercritical coal-based thermal power project in the hill range is facing strong opposition from the forest-dependent Savara and Jatapu tribal communities. T. Appala Naidu explores the dynamics at one of the most fertile regions in northern Andhra Pradesh, where local tribal communities are preparing to fight against environmental disruption they fear will be caused by the project

title: SIM-phony of scams: ordinary homes, extraordinary crimes in Hyderabad
content: Behind the hum of kitchens, chatter of tea stalls and the calm of ordinary streets, tiny SIM boxes blink in silent rhythm, channeling international calls and powering ‘digital arrest’ scams that drain crores from victims across India. Lavpreet Kaur peels back the curtain on how lax telecom checks, fragile banking systems and clever criminal networks transform everyday spaces into nerve centres of high-tech deception

title: BJP workers clash with police in Palakkad over Sabarimala gold-plating row
content: BJP State vice-president B. Gopalakrishnan and Palakkad east district president Prasanth Sivan led the march; Mahila Morcha workers too joined the protest by raising Ayyappa slogans.

title: Vizag Junior Lit Fest 2025: Registrations open for two days of stories and fun for young readers
content: Vizag Junior Lit Fest, a two-day celebration of stories, creativity and conversations, to be held in November with registrations for sessions opening on October 11

title: Karur police detain Salem district secretary of TVK
content: A case was registered against TVK workers for allegedly assaulting a private ambulance driver during the Karur stampede

title: Jagan demands a rollback on move to ‘privatise’ medical colleges in Andhra Pradesh
content: The YSRCP chief accuses Naidu of halting the works at ten medical colleges by issuing a stop memo in September 2024

title: Bihar Assembly Election LIVE updates: BJP says seat-sharing talks between allies are ‘positive’; Chirag remains tight-lipped
content: The EC has directed political parties to refrain from misusing AI-based tools to create deepfakes that distort information or spread misinformation on social media

title: Official crime data does not reflect women’s ordeal in Manipur 2023 conflict
content: Data show a spike in criminal activity in the State in 2023, but a drop in reported crimes against women during the conflict

title: Buffering Karnataka’s waterbodies
content: In the recently concluded monsoon session, the Karnataka government introduced the Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which amends the 2014 Act to define graded buffer zones around tanks based on their size. While there is no universally accepted definition of buffer zones, in many countries they are designated areas around waterbodies intended to minimise the negative impacts of human settlements, writes Chetan B.C.

title: Coldrif cough syrup banned in Bengal after child deaths linked to it in Madhya Pradesh
content: "The batch linked to the Madhya Pradesh incident has not entered West Bengal, but as a precautionary measure, we have informed all sellers to stop its sale," BCDA secretary Prithwi Basu said.

title: Chandigarh police registers FIR in Haryana IPS officer death case
content: In a letter to Chandigarh Police SSP Kanwardeep Kaur, Amneet P Kumar, a senior IAS officer, sought that “diluted sections of the SC/ST Act” that have been added in the FIR should be amended.

title:
Natarajasundaram Pillai, the nagaswaram
player who excelled in complex rhythms
content:
Pallavi Natarajasundaram Pillai, as he was known, was renowned for mallaris. The available recordings are an invaluable documentation of his style and a testimony to his astonishing grip on layam or thalam. There would be no dull moment in a concert by Natarajasundaram Pillai, says thavil  maestro 
Haridwaramangalam A.K. Palanivel

title: When Justice Party contemplated admitting Brahmins into its fold nearly 100 years ago
content: B. Munuswami Nayudu, the Chief Minister of Madras Presidency during 1930-32, tried in vain to admit ‘willing’ Brahmins to the party. At the party’s Nellore confederation in October 1929, he sought to amend the by-laws because the exclusion of one community had resulted in the party not being a ‘full representative’ of the Presidency

title: Remembering C. Minakshi, a trailblazing scholar and authority on Pallava history
content: She was the first woman to receive a doctorate from the University of Madras in 1936. In four years as a professional historian, she published over 30 articles and four books. In 1939, the ASI asked her to study the sculptures at the Vaikuntaperumal Temple in Kancheepuram. This work remains an authoritative reference on Pallava art

title: Interview | Author and Rajya Sabha MP Salma on juggling writing and politics
content: A new translation of Salma’s first novel, The Dark Hours of the Night, foregrounds the voices of marginalised women

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) demands to sack Mahayuti Minister over granting weapon licence to criminal’s brother
content: Yogesh Kadam allegedly overruled a police report to grant a gun licence to Sachin Ghaywal, the brother of notorious Pune gangster Nilesh Ghaywal

title: Bhupendra Patel outlines roadmap for ‘Viksit Gujarat, Viksit Bharat’
content: Under these plans, more than 500 projects have been identified, supported by investments exceeding ₹15 lakh crore

title: Rajasthan CM seeks expatriate Rajasthanis’ support for gems, jewellery hub
content: Bhajan Lal Sharma said Rajasthan was poised to become a 350 billion U.S. dollar economy and had an investment-friendly environment

title: Ruling NC MLA brings private member’s Bill to restore pre-2019 Land Grants Act in J&K
content: He said the Bill also sought to protect lawful occupants from eviction, ensure transparent renewals, and prioritize land grants for residents, cooperatives and local entrepreneurs

title: Centre’s Samanvaya platform traces about 1.52 lakh cybercrime links, facilitating 12,987 arrests
content: The platform is one of the verticals of Indian Cyber Crime Coordination Centre (I4C) for inter-States/Union Territories coordination

title: Athawale seeks action under SC/ST Act against man who tried to hurl shoe at CJI Gavai
content: The incident took place because some people from upper caste could not come to terms with the fact that Justice Gavai, from Dalit community, has risen to such a high position, says the Union Minister

title: 'Upgrading technical mission': Jaishankar meets Afghan FM; India to reopen embassy in Kabul
content: India is upgrading its Technical Mission in Kabul to an embassy, signaling a renewed commitment to Afghanistan's sovereignty and regional stability. External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlighted cooperation in mining and trade, while Afghanistan's Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi pledged not to allow Afghan territory for anti-India activities, emphasizing mutual respect and people-to-people ties.

title: Cough syrup deaths: SC rejects PIL seeking CBI probe, drug safety review; toll at 21 in MP
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed a plea for a CBI investigation into the deaths of children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. These deaths were reportedly caused by a toxic cough syrup. The manufacturer's owner has been arrested. Several states have banned the syrup, and the factory has been sealed.

title: Top contenders for Nobel Peace Prize; does Trump stand a chance?
content: A total of 338 individuals and organisations have been nominated for the 2025 Peace Prize. With no clear favourite, several possible names are being discussed in Oslo. The announcement will be made in Oslo, Norway, where the committee will name the laureate who reflects the values of Alfred Nobel, the 19th-century Swedish industrialist who founded the prize.

title: Hit by EU sanctions over Russia oil - India's Nayara struggles to sustain
content: Nayara Energy, a major Indian refinery with significant Russian ownership, is navigating EU sanctions by boosting domestic fuel distribution via increased rail transport. The company, now solely sourcing crude from Russia, faces challenges securing export markets and processing international payments.

title: H-1B visa rules: US govt plans five new changes; increased scrutiny, cap exemption &…
content: The US government is set to overhaul the H-1B visa program, introducing a $100,000 annual fee and tightening rules. Expect stricter oversight for employers with past violations, increased scrutiny of third-party placements, and a narrower scope for cap exemptions.  These changes aim to bolster program integrity and safeguard American jobs.

title: India’s most employable graduates in 2025: MBAs first; engineers a close second
content: According to the India Skills Report 2025 by Wheebox, MBA graduates are India’s most employable at 78%, followed by B.Tech (71.5%) and MCA (71%). The national employability rate stands at 54.81%, with rising demand for business, technology, and IT expertise. The report highlights upskilling, adaptability, and a blend of technical and human skills as key to job readiness.

title: IPL 2026 auction: Likely to take place in December; set to be staged in India
content: IPL 2026 mini-auction is set for December 13-15, with franchises submitting retention lists by November 15. The auction might return to India after overseas editions. Several high-profile players, including Sam Curran and Devon Conway, are reportedly being considered for release. Australian all-rounder Cameron Green is expected to be a major draw.

title: 'Priya Kapur behaving like Cinderella's stepmother': What Karisma's kids told HC
content: In a Delhi High Court inheritance battle, Sunjay Kapur's children from ex-wife Karisma Kapoor accused his current wife, Priya Kapur, of behaving like "Cinderella's stepmother" and usurping assets. They allege Priya presented a forged will to secure a larger share of the Rs 30,000 crore estate, putting the children in danger.

title: Career move: Rishi Sunak joins Microsoft, Anthropic; told not to lobby ministers
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has joined tech giants Microsoft and Anthropic as a paid advisor, focusing on artificial intelligence policy and global strategy.  His appointments come with strict ethical conditions from ACOBA, including a two-year lobbying ban and restrictions on using privileged information. This move signifies Sunak's continued influence in shaping AI's future from the private sector.

title: Mysterious explosions in Kabul: Did Pak carry out airstrike? Here’s what we know
content: Explosions rocked Kabul late Thursday night, causing panic. This follows an incident where the Pakistani military killed 30 militants. These militants were responsible for the deaths of nine soldiers and two officials in Balochistan. The Pakistani army claims India's involvement in the Balochistan attack. Investigations into the Kabul blasts are ongoing.

title: Another milestone for Bumrah! India seamer joins Dhoni, RoKo in elite list
content: Jasprit Bumrah has achieved a significant milestone. He is now the first Indian fast bowler to participate in 50 matches across all three formats of the game. This achievement follows his recent record as the fastest Indian bowler to claim 50 home Test wickets.

title: Sister Jean’s cause of death: Loyola-Chicago chaplain legend passes at 106
content: Sister Jean Dolores Schmidt, Loyola University Chicago's cherished chaplain, has passed away at 106. She gained global fame during the 2018 basketball team's Final Four run.  Sister Jean provided spiritual guidance and mentorship for decades. Her legacy extends beyond sports, encompassing a memoir and community programs.  She was a symbol of hope and faith for many.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: Jodhpur varsity students get 137 out of 100; results withdrawn
content: MBM Engineering University in Jodhpur has withdrawn BE II semester results. Students received marks exceeding the maximum possible in practical and sessional papers. The university cited a technical error by the agency responsible for online result preparation. Corrected results are expected soon. Approximately 800 students appeared for the exam held in May.

title: Buildings shake, lights out: Panicked residents flee as 7.6 quake hits Philippines
content: A powerful magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck off Davao Oriental in the Philippines, causing widespread panic and prompting evacuations due to tsunami threats. Videos depict chaos in hospitals and offices as tremors shook buildings. Authorities are warning of aftershocks and urging coastal residents to move to higher ground.

title: Avalanche hits Himachal's Dharamshala; snow cascades on Dhauladhar Hills - watch video
content: An avalanche struck the snow-covered Dhauladhar Hills in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh, on Friday. The powerful slide was captured on video, with no casualties reported thus far. This event follows heavy rains and snowfall across several districts, and a recent landslide that claimed 18 lives.

title: 'Chopped into 50 pieces': UP governor Anandiben Patel slams live-in relationships
content: Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel cautioned young women against live-in relationships at convocation ceremonies in Varanasi, citing orphanages as an outcome. She urged students to focus on education and national responsibility, warning against drug abuse and emphasizing the purpose of education for life change. Degrees were awarded to over 71,000 students.

title: Circumcision causes autism? Team Trump's new claim on Tylenol use
content: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. courted controversy by asserting an unproven link between infant circumcision, Tylenol use, and autism during a Cabinet meeting. He reiterated discredited theories connecting Tylenol use during pregnancy to autism, despite expert consensus refuting these claims. Kennedy's remarks have renewed concerns about his influence on evidence-based public health policy.

title: Breaking Good – how three scientists created materials that could save the planet
content: So, say hello to the men who turned chemistry from Breaking Bad into Breaking Good. This year’s Nobel Prize in Chemistry is actually pretty easy to get — and no, it doesn’t involve blue crystals or an RV in the desert. The 2025 Nobel went to Richard Robson, Susumu Kitagawa, and Omar Yaghi for inventing something called metal–organic frameworks, or MOFs. If that sounds like chemistry jargon designed to make you feel stupid, relax. MOFs are basically sponges made of metal and carbon, but on a molecular level — invisible, perfect, and outrageously clever.

title: Bengaluru horror: Mother strangles 2 children before killing herself in Bagalagunte
content: A 40-year-old woman tragically killed her two young children, aged four and one, before taking her own life at their Bengaluru residence. Police found the children strangled and the woman hanging. The motive behind this devastating incident remains unknown as investigations are ongoing.

title: Censor board denies certificate to Malayalam film 'Haal' over biryani scene
content: Shane Nigam's upcoming romantic drama 'Haal' faces release delays as the Censor Board suggests 15 changes, including a controversial beef biryani scene. Makers deny the scene's existence and have approached the Kerala High Court challenging the CBFC's decision, which could lead to an 'A' certificate.

title: 'Contrary to ... ': US to sell new air-to-air missiles to Pakistan? Embassy issues clarification
content: The US Embassy in India on Friday debunked reports of supplying new missiles or upgrades to Pakistan, clarifying a recent Department of War (DoW) announcement.  The embassy stated that a contract amendment for sustainment and spares does not involve delivering new Advanced-Medium-Range Air-to-Air Missiles (AMRAAMs) to Islamabad, countering earlier speculation.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for October today?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to dip, with analysts advising traders to sell on any rise. Technical indicators like EMA crossover, Bollinger Bands, and MACD signal strong bearish momentum. Investors should consider selling near ₹1,21,200–₹1,21,500 with targets at ₹1,20,000 and ₹1,19,100.

title: Pakistan: Roads blocked, mobile internet suspended in Islamabad - All you need to know
content: Pakistani authorities have closed major roads and suspended mobile internet services to preempt a protest march by the Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) in Islamabad. The TLP announced the march to protest Gaza killings, prompting a security crackdown including sealing the Red Zone and enforcing Section 144 across Punjab.

title: Nobel Peace Prize: 4 US president-winners; where they studied
content: US President Donald Trump has been nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize amid international endorsements. This article explores the educational backgrounds of the four American presidents who previously won the Nobel Peace Prize: Theodore Roosevelt, Woodrow Wilson, Jimmy Carter, and Barack Obama. It details their academic achievements, presidential tenures, reasons for receiving the prize, and current status, highlighting their diverse educational journeys from Harvard and Princeton to the US Naval Academy and beyond.

title: Why Russell Wilson won’t play against Eagles: QB’s Message to Wife Ciara
content: The New York Giants have benched veteran quarterback Russell Wilson for Jaxson Dart in their Week 6 game against the Eagles, marking Wilson's third consecutive game on the sidelines due to performance issues. Despite professional challenges, Wilson finds strength in his family, including wife Ciara and their children, and remains ready to contribute if called upon.

title: Italian swim world champion banned for stealing cosmetics at Singapore airport
content: Italian swimmers Benedetta Pilato and Chiara Tarantino have been banned for 90 days by the Italian swimming federation after being caught stealing cosmetics at Singapore airport. The athletes, who acknowledged their responsibility, will miss upcoming championships. Pilato stated she was involved independently of her will, drawing lessons from the experience.

title: Nobel Prize in Literature: Meet László Krasznahorkai - Kafka's literary heir of despair
content: Critics have called him “the Kafka of our time.” The New York Times described him as “a writer of haunting, Kafkaesque intensity.” The Guardian dubbed him “the Hungarian master of apocalypse.” Translator George Szirtes said his novels “come from the same Central European forest as Kafka’s.”

title: St Stephen’s asks students to pay DU and College fees separately
content: St. Stephen's College is facing scrutiny for allegedly overcharging first-year students on university fees and implementing a dual-payment system, violating Delhi University's single-portal rule. Students paid over three times DU's actual share, amounting to an estimated Rs 32 lakh extra. DU officials are investigating the matter, calling the overcharge the college's responsibility.

title: 'Why afraid?' BJP slams Mamata over SIR; accuses CM of 'inciting riots'
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party criticises West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for opposing electoral roll revisions. BJP leaders accuse Banerjee of inciting communal riots and protecting illegal voters. Banerjee warns of public outrage against the BJP's actions. She also criticises Union Home Minister Amit Shah, comparing him to a historical traitor.

title: 7.6 magnitude earthquake hits Philippines; tsunami warning issued
content: A powerful 7.2 magnitude earthquake jolted the Mindanao region of the Philippines on Friday. The seismic event originated at a considerable depth of 62 kilometers, according to the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre. This significant tremor has raised concerns across the affected area, prompting immediate attention and further investigation into its impact.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya spotted with Mahieka Sharma; who is she?
content: Cricketer Hardik Pandya was seen with model Mahieka Sharma at Mumbai Airport, marking their first public appearance together. This sighting follows speculation fuelled by their Instagram follows. Pandya is reportedly single after his divorce from Natasa Stankovic was announced in 2024. The India allrounder will not be seen on the cricket field in Australia as he recovers from injury.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,200; BSE Sensex up around 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday. While Nifty50 want above 25,200, BSE Sensex was up around 200 points.

title: Shubman Gill collects lucky 'first' as India Test captain vs West Indies
content: India's captain Shubman Gill finally won a toss after six consecutive losses, opting to bat against the West Indies in Delhi. India remain unchanged for the second Test, while the West Indies made two changes. Gill expressed excitement for the future after being appointed the ODI captain as well and emphasised on consistency in batting.

title: Trump sanctions hit! Indian nationals among 50 entities sanctioned for aiding Iran oil
content: America has imposed new sanctions targeting individuals and companies aiding Iran's oil and LPG exports. Three Indian nationals are among those sanctioned for their alleged roles. The US aims to disrupt Iran's revenue streams and its support for terrorist groups. These actions are part of a broader effort to dismantle Iran's energy export network.

title: Women's World Cup: How India can qualify for semis
content: India's 2025 ICC Women's Cricket World Cup campaign suffered its first blow with a three-wicket loss to South Africa. Despite the setback, India's semi-final qualification remains in their hands, requiring victories in at least three of their remaining four matches. Upcoming clashes against Australia, England, and New Zealand will be crucial.

title: Karwa Chauth 2025: Messages, quotes, wishes & images to share
content: Karwa Chauth will be celebrated in the US on October 9, 2025. Hindu women will observe a day-long fast for their husbands' long life and marital prosperity. The festival also highlights mutual respect and the emotional bond between partners. Couples will exchange greetings and tokens of love to mark this auspicious occasion. Wishes and quotes for the celebration are provided.

title: Most pristine star ever found reveals secrets about universe’s first moments
content: Astronomers have identified the most pristine star ever observed, located in the Milky Way's halo. This ancient star, with exceptionally low levels of heavy elements, offers a rare glimpse into the universe's earliest moments, potentially formed from the remnants of the first generation of stars.

title: ‘Awarded for nothing’: Trump hits out at Obama over Nobel Peace Prize win
content: President Trump, eyeing the Nobel Peace Prize, criticized Barack Obama's award while highlighting his role in a US-brokered peace deal between Israel and Hamas. The agreement, which secured the release of hostages and Palestinian prisoners, was announced as Trump prepared to travel to Egypt for its signing.

title: Indian engineer dies in UAE: 37-year-old IIT Madras alumnus succumbs to heart attack
content: An Indian engineer working in the UAE, Hariraj Sudevan, tragically passed away from a heart attack just hours after seeing his visiting wife and son off at the airport. He had spent a special evening celebrating his best friend's daughter's birthday before his sudden demise, leaving loved ones devastated.

title: NEET PG result: NBEMS disqualifies 22 candidates; here is why
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has cancelled NEET PG results of 22 candidates (2021-2025) for malpractice, including 13 from 2025. Additionally, 11 FMGE aspirants faced disqualification. NBEMS emphasized that using cancelled results for admission, employment, or registration is unlawful. The move underscores the board’s commitment to exam integrity amid rising scrutiny over transparency.

title: Big move! Karnataka approves 12 menstrual leaves for women employees across sectors
content: Karnataka has become India's first state to approve menstrual leave for women, allowing up to 12 sanctioned leaves annually. State minister Santosh Lad announced the progressive law, emphasizing its welfare-oriented approach for women. The decision marks a significant step for women's rights in the state.

title: Coldrif row intensifies: As toll rises, MP blames Tamil Nadu over licence; TN counters
content: The death toll from adulterated cough syrup reached 23 after two more children died of renal failure. Police arrested the owner of Tamil Nadu-based Sresan Pharmaceuticals, which manufactured the Coldrif medicine, for allegedly lacing the syrup with DEG. The incident has sparked a political blame game between state governments.

title: Expenses, income gap huge in farm sector: All India Kisan Sabha
content: AIKS leaders blame the Centre not implementing the C2+50% M.S. Swaminathan commission formula; Minister refutes charges, says MSP is decided after consultations with farm outfits

title: Delhi HC directs EC to allot election symbol to Akhil Bharatiya Jan Sangh for Bihar polls
content: The party in its plea said that the non-allotment of a symbol will take away its opportunity to contest elections

title: BJP Govt in Odisha reacts sharply to W.B. CM’s comment on Cuttack communal violence
content: Number of arrests has gone up to nine following fresh arrests of three persons in connection with the violence

title: Mamata says EC officials ‘threatening’ West Bengal govt. officers
content: CM says there are attempts to conduct a National Register of Citizens in the garb of SIR in the State

title: Odisha Police widen probe into recruitment scam
content: Raid was conducted on a prominent coaching centre of Bhubaneswar to ascertain any possible link between the coaching centre, job seekers, and the scamsters

title: Register FIR against Bajrang Dal members for molesting tribal women: Chhattisgarh women’s panel on nuns’ case
content: Complainants alleged that Bajrang Dal workers assaulted, abused, molested, and used casteist slurs at  them at Durg railway station

title: Kunbis call off a day-long protest after meeting Maharashtra Skill Minister Lodha
content: Protesters demand withdrawal of GR granting Kunbi caste certificates to Marathas, caste-wise census, and protection of OBC reservation rights.

title: Haryana IPS officer’s death: Oppn. steps up heat on BJP govt., calls for impartial probe
content: Wife urges CM to intervene, register FIR against people named in ‘note’ left behind by deceased officer; Saini visits residence to offer condolences

title: Panathuthazham flyover: Kozhikode MP alleges negligence on govt.’s part
content: The project remains stalled because the land acquisition process was never even started, claims M.K. Raghavan

title: The Hindu Group’s coffee-table book on legendary illustrator Maniam released
content: Veteran actor Sivakumar, an artist himself, released the first copy of the book, produced in association with Maniam Selven, the son of the late illustrator

title: Supreme Court rejects Centre’s plea for stricter timelines for execution of death row convicts
content: The top court said its 2014 Shatrughan Chauhan judgment, which the Centre sought to modify, was comprehensive and required no further review

title: Karnataka scientist who popularised dragon fruit cultivation and identified Siddu jackfruit variety gets award
content: Dr. Karunakaran is renowned for his work in popularising fruit varieties that are not only suitable for the parched conditions, but also fetch remunerative incomes to farmers.

title: Modi, Starmer call for a ‘two-state solution’ to Israel-Palestine conflict
content: Two Prime Ministers support “an immediate and lasting ceasefire”; Modi speaks with Trump over phone, congratulates him on Gaza peace initiative

title: Draft labour policy violates tripartite process: AITUC
content: Discussions with the CTUs as the main stakeholders before drafting such a policy is a standard and crucial practice established in India

title: Goal is to create 1 lakh blue-collar jobs through OMCAP, says Lokesh
content: Instructs officials of Skill Development Corporation to prepare a roadmap and move forward in a planned and systematic manner to achieve the goal

title: BJP’s Manipur MLAs meet Patra, seek end to President’s Rule
content: The group of MLAs conveyed to State in-charge Sambit Patra that there is “no infighting” within State BJP and that the Home Ministry should revoke President’s Rule and reinstate the popular government

title: What are the various electoral forms? | Explained
content: What is Form 6 used for in the context of electoral rolls? How can Overseas Electors register to vote? Which forms are used to raise objections or request corrections? What should citizens do to ensure their names are correctly included in the electoral rolls?

title: ‘Peace talks’ held in Leh; mobile Internet services restored
content: The first such meeting since the violence erupted on September 24 was chaired by Ladakh Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal; the meeting was attended by LAB chairman Thupstan Chhewang and co-chairman Chering Dorjay Lakruk, representatives of Buddhist organisations, Muslim bodies, Christian groups and leaders of the Congress and the BJP

title: PM Modi to launch initiatives to boost pulses production
content: Schemes target higher cultivation area, productivity; over 1,100 agri projects worth ₹42,000 crore to be inaugurated

title: Operation Numkhor: Customs seize three more vehicles
content: A Nissan Patrol, a Nissan Pickup Truck, and a Toyota Prado seized in Kochi. Total number of vehicles seized under Operation Numkhor now 43

title: Lok Sabha Speaker urges ethical adoption of AI to bridge the digital divide
content: Om Birla said that cooperation and knowledge-sharing can make technology a bridge rather than a barrier

title: Congress slams Modi’s praise for Israeli PM
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh criticises PM Narendra Modi for failing to mention the ongoing expansion of Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank or the devastating toll of the Gaza war

title: India sees increase in international and domestic airfares from 2019 to 2025
content: The 2025 trends were released by the Airports Council International Asia-Pacific & Middle East, the trade association representing airports

title: In Zubeen Garg's Death Probe, 2 Personal Security Officers Arrested
content: Two of Assamese music legend Zubeen Garg's personal security officers (PSOs) have been arrested by the Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing his death, police said on Friday.

title: 'Have Nothing To Fear': Pooja Khedkar's Mother Denies Role In Kidnapping Case
content: Manorama Khedkar, the mother of former IAS probationer Pooja Khedkar, who faces questioning in connection with the alleged kidnapping of a truck helper and obstruction of police action, denied any involvement in the case

title: Couldn't Repay Loan After Note Ban Loss: Raj Kundra On Rs 60 Crore Fraud Case
content: A case has been registered against Raj Kundra and Shilpa Shetty for allegedly duping a businessman in a loan-cum-investment deal.

title: Internet Banned In Islamabad, Rawalpindi Ahead Of Anti-Israel Protest In Pakistan
content: The Shehbaz Sharif government in Pakistan has suspended internet in the capital, Islamabad, and in Rawalpindi ahead of an anti-Israel protest called by Islamist political party Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP).

title: 'Nobel For Trump': Israeli Farmers Ahead Of Peace Prize Announcement
content: Hours before the Nobel Peace Prize announcement, US President Donald Trump received support from Israeli farmers who used tractors to plough a message on a farmland. It reads, "Nobel 4 Trump."

title: "Not Safe In Our Own Country": Northeast Woman Shares Bengaluru Ordeal
content: A shocking incident of discrimination has surfaced in Bengaluru, with a woman alleging that she was abused by an Uber auto driver since she is from the Northeast.

title: Supreme Court Hearing Today On Petition To Restore J&K's Statehood
content: The Supreme Court will hear a petition today seeking the immediate restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir and the implementation of directions passed by a constitutional bench in December 2023.

title: Girl Sexually Abused By Temple Priest In Tamil Nadu, Accused Arrested
content: A 75-year-old temple priest has been arrested under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act for allegedly sexually abusing a 13-year-old girl inside a temple near Kumbakonam in Tamil Nadu.

title: Team Trump Plans More H-1B Visa Restrictions After $100,000 Fee Hike
content: The Donald Trump administration in the United States is planning to go beyond the initial shock of the $100,000 mandatory fee and impose additional immigration restrictions on how employers can use the permit and who qualifies for it.

title: 7.5 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Off Southern Philippines, Tsunami Warning Issued
content: An earthquake of magnitude 7.5 struck offshore in the southern Philippines on Friday morning, the country's seismology agency said, with tsunami warnings issued in several countries and people in nearby coastal areas urged to move to higher ground.

title: "Barack Obama Got It For Nothing": Trump Tears Into Ex-President's Nobel Prize Win
content: US President Donald Trump, in his fervid pursuit of the Nobel Peace Prize, has criticised his predecessor Barack Obama's achievements, accusing him of "doing nothing" and "destroying our country".

title: Russia Strikes Kyiv Apartments, Energy Sites In "Massive Attack"
content: Russia has escalated aerial attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities and rail systems over recent weeks.

title: EPS Hints At Alliance After TVK Flags Seen At Rally, Vijay's Party Distances Itself
content: Edappadi K Palaniswami, the AIADMK chief, addressing a public meeting in Tamil Nadu's Namakkal district, described the sight of TVK flags at his rally as "the beginning of a new alliance."

title: 10-Year-Old Girl Raped, Murdered In Karnataka, Suspect Injured In Encounter
content: The body of a 10-year-old girl was found near Dodda Kere Maidan, close to Mysuru Palace, early Thursday morning. Police suspect the child was sexually assaulted before being murdered.

title: Akasa Air Co-Founder And Senior Vice President Neelu Khatri Resigns
content: Akasa Air's co-founder and Senior Vice President for international operations Neelu Khatri has put in her papers, marking a high-level exit at the three-year-old airline.

title: Netanyahu Pauses Security Meet On Gaza Peace Deal To Speak To PM Modi
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu spoke with PM Narendra Modi over the phone, halting the security cabinet meeting that was discussing a ceasefire and hostage release agreement under US President Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza Peace Plan.

title: US Sanctions Over 50 Firms, Including Indian Nationals, Over Iran Oil Trade
content: The US Department of the Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) on Thursday announced sanctions against more than 50 individuals, entities, and vessels for facilitating Iranian oil and LPG sales and shipments from Iran.

title: "Economic Superpower In Making": UK PM Lauds India's Growth Story
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Thursday that India is on track to becoming the third largest economy by 2028, an economic superpower in the making, and the United Kingdom is "perfectly placed to be partners" on that journey.

title: Ex-UK PM Rishi Sunak Joins Microsoft, Anthropic In Advisory Roles
content: Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on Thursday he has joined U.S. tech giant Microsoft and AI startup Anthropic as a senior adviser.
